trial_identification.studytitle: Improved characterisation of the clinical phenotype of Hereditary Motor Sensory Neuropathy of neuronal type with onset of symptoms in early childhood, especially with respect to disease progression with age and the incidence of such complications as foot deformity, contractures, scoliosis and respiratory involvement - an observational study.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Improved characterisation of the clinical phenotype of Hereditary Motor Sensory Neuropathy of neuronal type with onset of symptoms in early childhood, especially with respect to disease progression with age and the incidence of such complications as foot deformity, contractures, scoliosis and respiratory involvement - an observational study.

conditions.healthcondition: Hereditary motor sensory neuropathy of neuronal type with onset in early childhood

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other human genetics and inherited disorders

interventions.interventions: This study primarily constitutes a review of a well-defined cohort of patients. The interventions planned include clinical examination and quantitative strength testing, a hip X-ray, neurophysiology testing, and blood sampling for genetic testing.

primaryOutcome.outcome: A review of the neurophysiological abnormalities apparent in children and adults with this condition, including (where possible) serial assessment of neurophysiological function.
A review of pathological findings in this disorder, including re-assessment of nerve and muscle biopsies on all patients.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjects will have a diagnosis of HMSN of neuronal type with onset in early childhood, based upon their clinical findings and family history, neurophysiological assessments and, where applicable, pathological testing (nerve and muscle biopsies).
